questions.question: 1.Show the definition for a method called myMethod that 1) is visible outside the class and can only access class variables, 2) returns an array of integers, and 3) accepts two parameters which are a String and double, in that order.

answers.a: a.public static int[] myMethod(String param1, double param2){ ... }
answers.b: b.public int[] myMethod(String param1, double param2){ ... }
answers.d: d.public static[] int myMethod(String param1, double param2){ ... }

questions.question: 2.Which of the following statements is true about the concrete class model in Java?

answers.a: a.A concrete class is a class that cannot be instantiated, but can be used as a base class for other classes.
answers.b: b.A concrete class is a class that can be instantiated, and can contain both abstract and non-abstract methods.
answers.c: c.A concrete class is a class that can be instantiated, but can only contain non-abstract methods.
answers.d: d.A concrete class is a class that can be instantiated, but cannot contain any methods.

questions.question: 3.Which of the following methods and variables would be appropriate for the Customer class in the Release a Vehicle use case scenario?

answers.a: a.Methods: makeReservation(), cancelReservation(), Variables: customerName, customerAddress
answers.b: b.Methods: releaseVehicle(), cancelReservation(), Variables: vehicleType, rentalDate
answers.c: c.Methods: makePayment(), cancelReservation(), Variables: reservationNumber, totalCost
answers.d: d.Methods: makePayment(), releaseVehicle(), Variables: rentalDuration, pickupLocation
